rule: Code of Conduct. All members of the Wandering Shop agree to read and abide by our Code of Conduct. These rules summarize the Code of Conduct (CoC) for reporting purposes. If reporting something that violates the CoC in a way not listed in these rules, select this option.

rule: Harassment, threats, or aggressive behaviour are not permitted. Inciting actions against others, including in retaliation, is not permitted. This includes but is not limited to encouraging self-harm or sharing personal information that could result in an individual being targeted.

rule: Wandering Shop does not tolerate promotion of fascist, white supremacist, violent or hateful ideology or symbolism. This includes but is not limited to Holocaust denial, Nazi symbolism, and anti-trans, misogynistic, antisemitic and/or racist harassment; including in usernames, avatars, and profiles.

rule: On public timelines, Wandering Shop does not permit graphic sexual, violent, or otherwise disturbing images without a content/media warning. Also not permitted: gratuitous advertising, spam, and cross-posting/automated posting of content that is irrelevant or disruptive.

rule:
Be pervy, be kind.

We are a kink-positive and sex-positive community. Though it says rubber in the name, we welcome all types of risk aware consensual kink.

rule:
No harassment or abuse.

Racism, misogyny, transphobia, homophobia, or body shaming will not be tolerated.

rule:
Keep it legal

No child pornography. Users are assumed to be 18 years old or otherwise legal to view sexual content in their jurisdiction.

rule:
Use Content Warnings or Sensitive Content flags.

Since we federate with other instances please mark any media with exposed genitals as Sensitive Content or with a Content Warning. No exposed genitals in your avatar or banner image please.

rule:
Use the #promo hashtag on ads or commercial posts.

We're excited for kink vendors to participate in our community. That said we'd like to keep it more of a flea market than a mall. So that users can easily identify them: posts promoting goods and/or services must use the #promo hashtag.
